event_summary.en: ã€Duration:45 minã€‘ã€Reception Time:5mins. before your reservationã€‘It is a pavilion like no other, with no roof or walls, seamlessly blending into the forest of tranquility at the center of the Expo site.Here, we consider â€œResonanceâ€ to be the essence of technology that leads to a transformation of civilization, and share questions about the connection to other people, the world, and the future in a space that dissolves boundaries. We hope that the resonant experiences with visitors will provide clues to â€œFuture Society for Our Livesâ€. *If you are late for the reception time, you won't be able to enter. *You will need a smartphone and the web application to access the experience. For other notes, please check our pavilion website before visiting.

event_name.en: Signature Pavilion OCHIAI Yoichi "nullÂ²"Dialogue Mode

event_summary.en:
[Duration: 30min] [Gather: On the hour] Observe a story of the eternalâ€œnowâ€through a dialogue with the
Mirrored Body in a world shaped by computationl nature. *Please note that this experience features intense flashing lights and high volume sound. *Prepare the â€œMirrored BodyğŸ„¬â€ app in advance for a better experience.

event_name.en: DYNAMIC EQUILIBRIUM OF LIFEã€€Produced by FUKUOKA Shin-Ichi

event_summary.en: ã€MeetingTime:As indicatedã€‘ã€Time:15min.after enteringã€‘Experience a three-dimensional, interactive installation imbued with light that spreads across the pavilion space, where your body transforms into particles of light, allowing you to traverse the 3.8-billion-year history of life in a dynamic tapestry. Life maintains balance by continuously breaking itself down and rebuilding, coexisting through altruistic behaviors that support each other. Through this, you will learn about the flow of 'dynamic equilibrium,' which is the essence of life.

event_name.en: DYNAMIC EQUILIBRIUM OF LIFEã€€Produced by FUKUOKA Shin-Ichiã€€Haptics

event_summary.en: ã€MeetingTime: As indicatedã€‘ã€Time:15min.after enteringã€‘Experience a dynamic tapestry of life, tracing 3.8 billion years of life's history with a three-dimensional theater system composed of 320,000 delicate light particles, where your own body becomes one with the particles of light. In the Tactile Experience Accessibility Zone, those requiring visual or auditory assistance can feel vibrations from the floor and tactile devices synchronized with sound and video for enhanced immersion. We also offer audio guides using open-ear headphones and tablets featuring subtitle displays.

event_name.en: Signature Pavilionã€€KOYAMA Kundoã€€â€EARTH MARTâ€

event_summary.en: ã€Duration: 30 - 40 minutesã€‘ã€Reception time: during the reserved timeã€‘ã€Theme: Cycle of Livesã€‘ã€Producer: KOYAMA Kundoã€‘This is an imaginary supermarket. It is full of exciting shopping-like experiences that will reset your assumptions and make you rethink about the cuisine of the future. In the â€œMarketplace of Lifeâ€, you will encounter the stories of the effervescent diversity of life that sustains our diet. In the â€œMarketplace of the Futureâ€, you will glimpse a vision of the future and its technology - the wisdom and ingenuity of cuisine to be spun together for our future world. We will pickle â€œExpo-Pickles (Umeboshi)â€ in the pavilion during the exposition, and you have a chance to get coupons to eat them in 2050.

event_name.en: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi 'Dialogue Theater - sign of life -'

event_summary.en: [Duration:55min.]This pavilion serves as an experimental ground, Unveiling 'divides' scattered throughout the world and through 'dialogue,' we seek to resolve.Dialogue, it awakens us, To the possibility of deeper understanding, That within me, you reside, And within you, I abide.Together, we can forge, A brighter future, side by side.Now, let us together step forth, Within this pavilion, Towards a future free from division. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

This program does not include admission to the Participatory Theater, one of the attractions, but you can enjoy the other interactive exhibits.   *Duration is just an estimate, as there is no time-based rotation system.   *Please use the public toilets outside the pavilion before entering. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name.en: Advanced Air Mobility Station

event_summary.en: [Duration 45min]This is an exhibition facility of a future society with eVTOLs, offering a comprehensive experience using vibrations, sound, and visuals.If you fall into following categories, please inform to our staff. -Individuals having difficulty in standing or walking on their own, having medical devices such as pacemakers which may be affected by vibrations or magnets, with prosthetic limbs, white cane users, pregnant women, and wheelchair users. -Children aged 6 and under can experience the exhibit while holding hands with their guardians.

event_summary.en: Inspired by a childâ€™s toy building blocks, the UK Pavilion represents the culmination of little ideas that have the power to combine into world-changing innovations. Every idea, just like every simple building block, has the potential to grow into something great.Our pavilion, through an immersive experience, will showcase Great Britain and Northern Ireland as a place of opportunity welcoming the worldâ€™s brightest minds to come together and build solutions to global challenges.Come Build The Future with us at the UK Pavilion!

event_summary.en: [Duration: 15 minutes] [You may arrive up to 15 mins before your reservation time] Embark on a one-of-a-kind multisensory adventure as you follow the sun across Australia. Immerse yourself in the sounds, sights and smells of Australia and be surprised as you wander through the tranquil bush, gaze into the night sky, and dive into waterways. Discover the deep connection between Australia's First Nations peoples and Country and learn how ancient wisdom is guiding a more sustainable future. Experience a world where the past, present and future come together to create a brighter tomorrow. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.
event_summary.fr: [DurÃ©e 15 minutes] [Rassembler 15 minutes avant l'heure de rÃ©servation affichÃ©e] Embarquez pour une aventure multisensorielle unique en son genre en suivant le soleil Ã  travers l'Australie. Immergez-vous dans les sons, les images et les odeurs de l'Australie et laissez-vous surprendre en vous promenant dans le bush tranquille, en contemplant le ciel nocturne et en plongeant dans les cours d'eau. DÃ©couvrez le lien profond entre les peuples des PremiÃ¨res nations d'Australie et le pays et apprenez comment la sagesse ancestrale guide un avenir plus durable. *RÃ©servation obligatoire pour les enfants de moins de 3 ans.

event_summary.en: [Duration: 20 minutes] Experience the UN Pavilion at Expo 2025, where over 30 UN agencies unite under the theme â€œUnited for a Better Future.â€ Discover a stunning immersive movie in the massive half-dome theater, walk through 80 years of UN history on the â€œTimeline Wall,â€ and explore the 'Orb Room,' where everyday objects reveal connections to the UN's impact worldwide. event_summary.en: The NTT Pavilion offers visitors an astonishing experience with a look at the future of communications using IOWN, a next-generation communications infrastructure, to transcend physical distances and emotional barriers and share not only video and audio, but also actual spaces that are at a distance and the sensory experiences of people and objects in a different place. Duration of experience: 30 minutes. Note: The reception opens 15 minutes prior to reservation times. Please be aware of the following points when making a reservation. Intense light, large sounds, darkness, the use of 3D glasses, and other experiences are involved. Visitors may be photographed or recorded and used as part of the presentation. Children under the age of three are also permitted to enter. The experience is wheelchair accessible. Assistance dogs may accompany visitors. For other cautionary information, please refer to the overview on the event website before making your reservation.

event_name.en: Netherlands Pavilion Common Ground

event_summary.en: Common Ground is the theme of the Netherlands participation. Netherlands Pavilion aims to be an open space where people can meet, learn from each other, and inspire one another. A place where we can unite our energy to create healthy and happy societies.As a message of hope for a resilient future, the design of the Netherlands Pavilion features an anthropogenic (â€˜man-madeâ€™) sun. It symbolises the rising sun â€“ a future empowered by collaboration and energy that is clean, unlimited, and accessible for all: a new dawn.

event_name.en: EXPO2025 'One Step to the Future! -Voices of Love Connects the World-' Arena

event_summary.en: SUMMARY:The Kansai born Takarazuka Revue is expanding its activities both domestically and internationally. The Takarazuka graduates will present a unique entertainment by reciting famous Takarazuka scenes and songs that have a connection with each country. DATES: 29 Apr - 1 May. DOORS OPEN: 1 hr before show. RUN TIME: Approx. 80 mins. SEATS: Reserved in blocks (free seating within blocks.) NOTES: Wheelchair users, please reserve wheelchair seats (can be accompanied by one carer.) Pre-school children are not permitted. For other details, please check the official website and the Visitors app. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_summary.en: ã€Date: May 1thã€‘ã€17:30-19:45 (OPEN17:00)ã€‘ã€Summaryã€‘Womenâ€™s Pavilion.The event focuses on Hungarian women whose activities connect the cultures of Hungary and Japan. The second part will focus on Hungarian ceramic artists and the Hungarian pioneer of the Japanese kokeshi art.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name.en: Nigiri sushi making experience of ã€Sushi rice seasoning powderã€

event_summary.en: [Dates] April 13 - May 12 Weekdays: 13:15 | Weekends & Holidays: 13:15, 15:15, 17:15[Summary] Learn to make sushi using Sushinoko, a powdered sushi vinegar with62 years of history. Tamanoi Vinegar, based in Sakai, Osaka-the birthplaceof Japanese vinegar-has been perfecting the craft since 1590. Discovertraditional sushi-making techniques![Duration] 30 min (Arrive 15 min early. No late entry.)[Age] 6+ (Ages 6-12 require an adult reservation.)[Note] Check allergy information before participating. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_summary.en:
Osaka Gas metanation tour  is a plant tour in the Area Carbon Recycle Factory of making methane with carbon dioxide (CO2) and hydrogen. We gather the CO2 collected from the atmosphere or the biogas and  use it as raw materials of the city gas, which we use as the fuel  for the kitchen of the guesthouse,  : Approx.40 minutes. You will be transported to the  plant by a dedicated bus ** departing from the front of the Gas Pavilion. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.
**The bus will depart on time, so if you are late you will not be able to participate. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

event_name.en: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi "Dialogue Theater - sign of life -"ã€€Documentary Footage

event_summary.en:
[Duration:15min.]
To create Dialogue Theater - sign of life, the production team visited Totsukawa Village in Nara Prefecture and Fukuchiyama City in Kyoto Prefecture on many occasions. There, they took over the old school buildings and interacted with the local community. KAWASE Naomi directed films that were produced to record the history of the school buildings before relocation, as well as the memories of the former students who spent their days there amid rich natural surroundings.

event_name.en: [Junior SDGs Camp] EXPO Site Tour (*Please check the departure point with Visitors App)

event_summary.en: ã€Summaryã€‘This tour takes you around the cutting-edge spots within the Expo site, with a focus on the themes of SDGs and architecture. *The tour theme and departure point will change depending on the date of the event. ã€Tour theme and departure pointã€‘Auguts 1st-5th: Cutting-edge environmental technology tour(depart from Junior SDGs Camp), 6th-11th: Unique building materials discovery tour(depart from Junior SDGs Camp), 12th-17th: Unique rest areas tour created by young architects(depart from Junior SDGs Camp), 18th-23rd: Zero-emission energy tour(depart from Festival Station), 24th-29th: Pritzker Prize architects' pavilions tour(depart from Festival Station), 30th-31st: Circular architecture tour(depart from Festival Station)

event_name.en: [Junior SDGs Camp] Osaka-Kansai Expo ESD Program (Switzerland ver.)

event_summary.en: *This event will be held at Junior SDGs Camp. [Dates: August 3rd, 8th, 22nd, 26th][Target] Middle and High School Students [Summary] We will invite Swiss presenters to introduce an overview of the country and their initiatives regarding the SDGs in Switzerland, as well as engage in discussions comparing these with Japan and what we can do ourselves. Additionally, we will share a global initiative called 'One Million Youth Action Challenge' that began in Switzerland. *This program will be conducted in English.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name.en: High School Students Dream Award

event_summary.en: The 'High School Students' Dream Award in Osaka/Kansai Expo'is a contest in which high school students, who will be responsible for the future,combine solving social problems with their own dreams and formulatingbusiness ideas to make them come true. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_summary.en: The Hungarian Pavilion emphasizes a close connection to nature and the preservation of culture. Its central theme is folk music, which not only features prominently in the exhibition space but also in the main attraction, an immersive performance in the central area. Through the ephemeral and unique nature of the live show, the pavilion aims to illustrate the close relationship between humans and their environment. Duration: 30 min.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_name.en: ÄŒÃSLAVSKÃ â€“ TOKYO â€“ 1964ã€€General seats

event_summary.en:
General seats
This stage production is inspired by the success of VÄ›ra ÄŒÃ¡slavskÃ¡, a prominent female gymnast at the 1964 Tokyo Olympics. Based on true events but presented as fiction, the play explores the encounter and cultural exchange between Japan and the Czech Republic. Japanese and Czech puppeteers perform together, weaving the story through various forms such as puppetry, shadow play, and video projection. Japanese and Czech sports commentators guide the audience throughout. Please note that entry and exit during the performance are not permitted.

event_summary.en:
General seats
Japanese anime has now become a part of Japanese culture that is loved by people of all ages around the world.
In this concert, we are proud to present a powerful live performance of many well-known anime songs by the Middle Army Band of the JGSDF.
The program features a wide variety of songs spanning different genres and eras, including theme songs that captivated us in our childhood and music that enhances popular anime.
To everyone who discovered Japanese culture through anime, and to all music lovers, we hope to share with you the full charm of wind ensemble music.

event_name.en: Signature Pavilion KAWASE Naomi 'Dialogue Theater - sign of life -'ã€€Documentary Footage

event_summary.en: [Duration:45min.]To create Dialogue Theater - sign of life, the production team visited Totsukawa Village in Nara Prefecture and Fukuchiyama City in Kyoto Prefecture on many occasions. There, they took over the old school buildings and interacted with the local community. KAWASE Naomi directed films that were produced to record the history of the school buildings before relocation, as well as the memories of the former students who spent their days there amid rich natural surroundings. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

To create Dialogue Theater, the production team visited Totsukawa Village in Nara Pref. and Fukuchiyama City in Kyoto Pref. on many occasions. There, they took over the old school buildings and interacted with the local community. KAWASE Naomi directed films that were produced to record the history of the school buildings before relocation, as well as the memories of the former students who spent their days there amid rich natural surroundings. *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old.

event_summary.en: [Summary] This tour takes you around the cutting-edge spots within the Expo site, with a focus on the themes of SDGs and architecture. *The tour theme and departure point will change depending on the date of the event. [Tour theme and departure point] Sep. 3rd-6th: Circular architecture tour(depart from Festival Station), 7th-15th: Wooden architecture tour(depart from Festival Station), 17th-23rd: Bioenergy tour(depart from Festival Station), 24th-28th: Designer toilet tour(depart from Junior SDGs Camp)

event_name.en: WA Space<Music and Dance Across Generations>

event_summary.en: ã€Date: September 5thã€‘ã€17:00-19:30 (OPEN16:30)ã€‘ã€Summaryã€‘Womenâ€™s Pavilion.An inspiring meeting with two extraordinary women who built exceptional careers in Poland. Yuka Ebihara, a Japanese ballerina and first soloist of the Polish National Ballet, shares her artistic journey. Urszula Dudziak, Polandâ€™s most recognized jazz artist, known for Papaya and 50+ albums, inspires with her story of perseverance and passion, proving dreams have no limits.	 *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.

event_name.en: WA Space<Career transformation starting with recurrent education>

event_summary.en: ã€Date: September 5thã€‘ã€12:30-14:15 (OPEN12:00)ã€‘ã€Summaryã€‘Womenâ€™s Pavilion.'Career transformation starting with recurrent education ~Learning that changes your life~' is an event to consider how you can change your life and career through re-learning after becoming a working adult (recurrent education). In the first part, Professor Ouchi and Lecturer Funakoshi from Kwansei Gakuin University's Women's Leadership Development Program will talk in a dialogue format about the program's achievements and the importance of recurrent education.  *Reservations are required for children under 3 years old if they wish to use the seats.
